issue.title: Discussion: consider migrating  to TiKV repo?
issue.body:
I was shocked at TiDB Hackathon by this project, it is mature enough and I think it can be used as the official TiKV CLI. 

I recommend to migrate to TiKV repo directly, but IMO, we need to use another name, not `ticli`

How do you think about? @busyjay @sunxiaoguang @c4pt0r

issue.title: Backup txn kv data via br

labels.name: type/feature-request
labels.description: This is a feature requests on the product

labels.name: component/br
labels.description: This issue is related to BR of TiDB.

issue.body:
## Feature Request

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...] -->
We can backup `raw` API data via `br` for `tikv` cluster. but for `txn` API data. we don't have such way to do so. and this will decrease the cluster operation and maintenance capabilities of data loss.

**Describe the feature you'd like:**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
Backup `txn` API data via `br`.

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**
<!-- A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->
We can implement this feature in a simple way. we can just allow backup full range `txn` data first. the basic code logic is as below:
### Backup
- [ ] Add a new `txn` subcommand in [`backup`](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/master/br/cmd/br/backup.go#L154) just like `raw` command.
- [ ] Implement the `RunBackupTxn` function. just like [RunBackup](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/backup.go#L277)
    - [ ] Get global snapshot timestamp from `pd` and stop moving GC forward. just like [here](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/backup.go#L341-L360)
    - [ ] Build the backup key range. firstly we can simply transform a full backup range from utils. https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/1659c3ea486d16ee161b28b7efad43e2f641f808/util/ranger/points.go#L168
    - [ ] Reuse [backupRanges](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/backup/client.go#L561) and the default backup request can be same as tidb backup 
https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/backup.go#L381-L391
- [ ] (optional challenging work) abstract `RunBackup` and `RunBackupTxn`.

### Restore
- [ ] Add a new `txn` subcommand in [`restore`](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/master/br/cmd/br/restore.go#L177)
- [ ] Distinguish the tidb backup and `txn` backup after [read](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/common.go#L646) `BackupMeta` file by condition 
    ```
    func isTxnBackup(backupMeta *pb.BackupMeta) bool {
        return len(backupMeta.Schemas) == 0 && !backupMeta.IsRawKv
    }
    ```
- [ ] Implement the `RunRestoreTxn` function. just like [RunRestoreRaw](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/restore_raw.go#L61). because we don't need to create tables. so the most logic is as same as raw restore.
    - [ ] Get backup file ranges by iterate backupMeta.Files.
    - [ ] Split ranges to let region distribute evenly. https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/restore_raw.go#L149
    - [ ] Restore backup files but ignore start key and end key https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/restore_raw.go#L160

**Teachability, Documentation, Adoption, Migration Strategy:**
<!-- If you can, explain some scenarios how users might use this, situations it would be helpful in. Any API designs, mockups, or diagrams are also helpful. -->

comment.body: @3pointer can you give some advices about how to add test too?

issue.title: Backup txn kv data via br
issue.body:
## Feature Request

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:
<!-- A description of what the problem is. -->
We can backup `raw` API data via `br` for `tikv` cluster. but for `txn` API data. we don't have such way to do so. and this will decrease the cluster operation and maintenance capabilities of data loss.

### Describe the feature you'd like:
<!-- A description of what you want to happen. -->
Backup `txn` API data via `br`.

### Describe alternatives you've considered:
<!-- A description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->
One easy way to implement this feature is building backup `txn` kv capabilities on existing `raw` kv backup.
The main process is 
- [ ] implement backup `txn` command in `br`.
- [ ] Get global `txn` snapshot timestamp from `pd` and stop GC moving forward during backup.
- [ ] Build `EntryScanner` to scan valid `txn` kv data in `tikv`.
- [ ] implement restore command in `br`.

In addition, we need to backup/restore twice internally if we choose this way. because `txn` data has two `CFs`  and `raw` kv backup only support backup one `CF` at a time.

### Teachability, Documentation, Adoption, Migration Strategy:
<!-- If you can, explain some scenarios how users might use this, or situations in which it would be helpful. Any API designs, mockups, or diagrams are also helpful. -->

comment.body:
> Reuse Raw backup

@3pointer seem we also need to backup Lock CF, right?

## Feature Request

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:
<!-- A description of what the problem is. -->
We can backup `raw` API data via `br` for `tikv` cluster. but for `txn` API data. we don't have such way to do so. and this will decrease the cluster operation and maintenance capabilities of data loss.

### Describe the feature you'd like:
<!-- A description of what you want to happen. -->
Backup `txn` API data via `br`.

### Describe alternatives you've considered:
<!-- A description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->
One easy way to implement this feature is building backup `txn` kv capabilities on existing `raw` kv backup.
The main process is 
- [ ] implement backup `txn` command in `br`.
- [ ] Get global `txn` snapshot timestamp from `pd` and stop GC moving forward during backup.
- [ ] Build `EntryScanner` to scan valid `txn` kv data in `tikv`.
- [ ] implement restore command in `br`.

In addition, we need to backup/restore twice internally if we choose this way. because `txn` data has two `CFs`  and `raw` kv backup only support backup one `CF` at a time.

### Teachability, Documentation, Adoption, Migration Strategy:
<!-- If you can, explain some scenarios how users might use this, or situations in which it would be helpful. Any API designs, mockups, or diagrams are also helpful. -->

comment.body:
> In addition, we need to backup/restore twice internally if we choose this way. because txn data has two CFs and raw kv backup only support backup one CF at a time.

@3pointer for TiDB backup, do we also do twice internally? If we use a similar way like backup all databases for TiDB, will it be easier?

issue.title: Backup txn kv data via br
issue.body:
## Feature Request

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:
<!-- A description of what the problem is. -->
We can backup `raw` API data via `br` for `tikv` cluster. but for `txn` API data. we don't have such way to do so. and this will decrease the cluster operation and maintenance capabilities of data loss.

### Describe the feature you'd like:
<!-- A description of what you want to happen. -->

### Describe alternatives you've considered:
<!-- A description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->
One easy way to implement this feature is building backup `txn` kv capabilities on existing `raw` kv backup.
The main process is

- [ ] Build `EntryScanner` to scan valid `txn` kv data in `tikv`.
- [ ] implement restore command in `br`.

In addition, we need to backup/restore twice internally if we choose this way. because `txn` data has two `CFs`  and `raw` kv backup only support backup one CF at a time.

### Teachability, Documentation, Adoption, Migration Strategy:
<!-- If you can, explain some scenarios how users might use this, or situations in which it would be helpful. Any API designs, mockups, or diagrams are also helpful. -->

comment.body: @3pointer no need to control GC? how to guarantee the transaction consistency?

payload.description: A toy project like cowsay or ponysay

comment.body:
IMO, why not write like below to reduce the indention?

```go
if err = f(tx); err != nil {
    tx.Rollback()
    return err
}

err = tx.Commit()
...
```

pull_request.title: Fix SQLite and add support for mvSQLite.
pull_request.body:
Previously the SQLite backend didn't work because of a missing spread operator in `execQuery`.

This PR also added a few new options and mechanisms to support [mvSQLite](https://github.com/losfair/mvsqlite):

- Configurable `MaxOpenConns` and `MaxIdleConns`
- Optimistic transactions and automatic retry

repo.description: A Go port of Yahoo! Cloud Serving Benchmark (YCSB)

issue.title: use table output for better user experience
issue.body: Hi all, I'm working on this PR to give a try for outputting the result as table style. Originally, the output is a line and not aligned. With table style output, we can get better user experience and it can be much more convenient to copy values. The output would like this: in comparison, the original output is like this: This is a simple try and I have not written it in a better way. I would first like to get some feedback on this approach and later I can make it better. Any feedback is welcomed.

comment.body:
thanks @sillydong 

can you do the same thing for go-ycsb?

comment.body:
@sillydong 

> I will try adding a flag output to control the output style, available values may be table,plaintext,json, the default will be table for human read. Is this OK?

Fine, but IMO I prefer plain instead of plaintext :-)

For CI, means PingCAP's internal CI or bench system, has not been public.

comment.body:
cool, maybe it is better to provide an output format flag, like table or origin raw message? so we can further support  JSON, etc. 

Another thing maybe we already used some scripts to parse the output results in our CI, so here we need to ensure the compatibility.

issue.title: Discussion: consider migrating  to TiKV repo?
issue.body:
I was shocked at TiDB Hackathon by this project, it is mature enough and I think it can be used as the official TiKV CLI. 

I recommend to migrate to TiKV repo directly, but IMO, we need to use another name, not `ticli`

How do you think about? @busyjay @sunxiaoguang @c4pt0r

issue.title: Backup txn kv data via br

labels.name: type/feature-request
labels.description: This is a feature requests on the product

labels.name: component/br
labels.description: This issue is related to BR of TiDB.

issue.body:
## Feature Request

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...] -->
We can backup `raw` API data via `br` for `tikv` cluster. but for `txn` API data. we don't have such way to do so. and this will decrease the cluster operation and maintenance capabilities of data loss.

**Describe the feature you'd like:**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
Backup `txn` API data via `br`.

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**
<!-- A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->
We can implement this feature in a simple way. we can just allow backup full range `txn` data first. the basic code logic is as below:
### Backup
- [ ] Add a new `txn` subcommand in [`backup`](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/master/br/cmd/br/backup.go#L154) just like `raw` command.
- [ ] Implement the `RunBackupTxn` function. just like [RunBackup](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/backup.go#L277)
    - [ ] Get global snapshot timestamp from `pd` and stop moving GC forward. just like [here](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/backup.go#L341-L360)
    - [ ] Build the backup key range. firstly we can simply transform a full backup range from utils. https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/1659c3ea486d16ee161b28b7efad43e2f641f808/util/ranger/points.go#L168
    - [ ] Reuse [backupRanges](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/backup/client.go#L561) and the default backup request can be same as tidb backup 
https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/backup.go#L381-L391
- [ ] (optional challenging work) abstract `RunBackup` and `RunBackupTxn`.

### Restore
- [ ] Add a new `txn` subcommand in [`restore`](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/master/br/cmd/br/restore.go#L177)
- [ ] Distinguish the tidb backup and `txn` backup after [read](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/common.go#L646) `BackupMeta` file by condition 
    ```
    func isTxnBackup(backupMeta *pb.BackupMeta) bool {
        return len(backupMeta.Schemas) == 0 && !backupMeta.IsRawKv
    }
    ```
- [ ] Implement the `RunRestoreTxn` function. just like [RunRestoreRaw](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/restore_raw.go#L61). because we don't need to create tables. so the most logic is as same as raw restore.
    - [ ] Get backup file ranges by iterate backupMeta.Files.
    - [ ] Split ranges to let region distribute evenly. https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/restore_raw.go#L149
    - [ ] Restore backup files but ignore start key and end key https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/restore_raw.go#L160

**Teachability, Documentation, Adoption, Migration Strategy:**
<!-- If you can, explain some scenarios how users might use this, situations it would be helpful in. Any API designs, mockups, or diagrams are also helpful. -->

comment.body: @3pointer can you give some advices about how to add test too?

issue.title: Backup txn kv data via br
issue.body:
## Feature Request

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:
<!-- A description of what the problem is. -->
We can backup `raw` API data via `br` for `tikv` cluster. but for `txn` API data. we don't have such way to do so. and this will decrease the cluster operation and maintenance capabilities of data loss.

### Describe the feature you'd like:
<!-- A description of what you want to happen. -->
Backup `txn` API data via `br`.

### Describe alternatives you've considered:
<!-- A description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->
One easy way to implement this feature is building backup `txn` kv capabilities on existing `raw` kv backup.
The main process is 
- [ ] implement backup `txn` command in `br`.
- [ ] Get global `txn` snapshot timestamp from `pd` and stop GC moving forward during backup.
- [ ] Build `EntryScanner` to scan valid `txn` kv data in `tikv`.
- [ ] implement restore command in `br`.

In addition, we need to backup/restore twice internally if we choose this way. because `txn` data has two `CFs`  and `raw` kv backup only support backup one `CF` at a time.

### Teachability, Documentation, Adoption, Migration Strategy:
<!-- If you can, explain some scenarios how users might use this, or situations in which it would be helpful. Any API designs, mockups, or diagrams are also helpful. -->

comment.body:
> Reuse Raw backup

@3pointer seem we also need to backup Lock CF, right?

pull_request.title: Fix SQLite and add support for mvSQLite.
pull_request.body:
Previously the SQLite backend didn't work because of a missing spread operator in `execQuery`.

This PR also added a few new options and mechanisms to support [mvSQLite](https://github.com/losfair/mvsqlite):

- Configurable `MaxOpenConns` and `MaxIdleConns`
- Optimistic transactions and automatic retry

issue.title: use table output for better user experience
issue.body: Hi all, I'm working on this PR to give a try for outputting the result as table style. Originally, the output is a line and not aligned. With table style output, we can get better user experience and it can be much more convenient to copy values. The output would like this: in comparison, the original output is like this: This is a simple try and I have not written it in a better way. I would first like to get some feedback on this approach and later I can make it better. Any feedback is welcomed.

comment.body:
thanks @sillydong 

can you do the same thing for go-ycsb?

cool, maybe it is better to provide an output format flag, like table or origin raw message? so we can further support  JSON, etc.

issue.title: Discussion: consider migrating  to TiKV repo?
issue.body:
I was shocked at TiDB Hackathon by this project, it is mature enough and I think it can be used as the official TiKV CLI. 

I recommend to migrate to TiKV repo directly, but IMO, we need to use another name, not `ticli`

How do you think about? @busyjay @sunxiaoguang @c4pt0r

issue.title: Backup txn kv data via br

labels.name: type/feature-request
labels.description: This is a feature requests on the product

labels.name: component/br
labels.description: This issue is related to BR of TiDB.

issue.body:
## Feature Request

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...] -->
We can backup `raw` API data via `br` for `tikv` cluster. but for `txn` API data. we don't have such way to do so. and this will decrease the cluster operation and maintenance capabilities of data loss.

**Describe the feature you'd like:**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
Backup `txn` API data via `br`.

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**
<!-- A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->
We can implement this feature in a simple way. we can just allow backup full range `txn` data first. the basic code logic is as below:
### Backup
- [ ] Add a new `txn` subcommand in [`backup`](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/master/br/cmd/br/backup.go#L154) just like `raw` command.
- [ ] Implement the `RunBackupTxn` function. just like [RunBackup](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/backup.go#L277)
    - [ ] Get global snapshot timestamp from `pd` and stop moving GC forward. just like [here](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/backup.go#L341-L360)
    - [ ] Build the backup key range. firstly we can simply transform a full backup range from utils. https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/1659c3ea486d16ee161b28b7efad43e2f641f808/util/ranger/points.go#L168
    - [ ] Reuse [backupRanges](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/backup/client.go#L561) and the default backup request can be same as tidb backup 
https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/backup.go#L381-L391
- [ ] (optional challenging work) abstract `RunBackup` and `RunBackupTxn`.

### Restore
- [ ] Add a new `txn` subcommand in [`restore`](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/master/br/cmd/br/restore.go#L177)
- [ ] Distinguish the tidb backup and `txn` backup after [read](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/common.go#L646) `BackupMeta` file by condition 
    ```
    func isTxnBackup(backupMeta *pb.BackupMeta) bool {
        return len(backupMeta.Schemas) == 0 && !backupMeta.IsRawKv
    }
    ```
- [ ] Implement the `RunRestoreTxn` function. just like [RunRestoreRaw](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/restore_raw.go#L61). because we don't need to create tables. so the most logic is as same as raw restore.
    - [ ] Get backup file ranges by iterate backupMeta.Files.
    - [ ] Split ranges to let region distribute evenly. https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/restore_raw.go#L149
    - [ ] Restore backup files but ignore start key and end key https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/aa49a4c072b8cec6d3f6b60cc1453fe60ae3dd48/br/pkg/task/restore_raw.go#L160

**Teachability, Documentation, Adoption, Migration Strategy:**
<!-- If you can, explain some scenarios how users might use this, situations it would be helpful in. Any API designs, mockups, or diagrams are also helpful. -->

comment.body: @3pointer can you give some advices about how to add test too?

issue.title: Backup txn kv data via br
issue.body:
## Feature Request

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:
<!-- A description of what the problem is. -->
We can backup `raw` API data via `br` for `tikv` cluster. but for `txn` API data. we don't have such way to do so. and this will decrease the cluster operation and maintenance capabilities of data loss.

### Describe the feature you'd like:
<!-- A description of what you want to happen. -->
Backup `txn` API data via `br`.

### Describe alternatives you've considered:
<!-- A description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->
One easy way to implement this feature is building backup `txn` kv capabilities on existing `raw` kv backup.
The main process is 
- [ ] implement backup `txn` command in `br`.
- [ ] Get global `txn` snapshot timestamp from `pd` and stop GC moving forward during backup.
- [ ] Build `EntryScanner` to scan valid `txn` kv data in `tikv`.
- [ ] implement restore command in `br`.

In addition, we need to backup/restore twice internally if we choose this way. because `txn` data has two `CFs`  and `raw` kv backup only support backup one `CF` at a time.

### Teachability, Documentation, Adoption, Migration Strategy:
<!-- If you can, explain some scenarios how users might use this, or situations in which it would be helpful. Any API designs, mockups, or diagrams are also helpful. -->

comment.body:
> Reuse Raw backup

@3pointer seem we also need to backup Lock CF, right?

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:

We can backup `raw` API data via `br` for `tikv` cluster. but for `txn` API data. we don't have such way to do so. and this will decrease the cluster operation and maintenance capabilities of data loss.

### Describe the feature you'd like:
<!-- A description of what you want to happen. -->
Backup `txn` API data via `br`.

### Describe alternatives you've considered:
<!-- A description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->
One easy way to implement this feature is building backup `txn` kv capabilities on existing `raw` kv backup.
The main process is 
- [ ] implement backup `txn` command in `br`.
- [ ] Get global `txn` snapshot timestamp from `pd` and stop GC moving forward during backup.
- [ ] Build `EntryScanner` to scan valid `txn` kv data in `tikv`.
- [ ] implement restore command in `br`.

In addition, we need to backup/restore twice internally if we choose this way. because `txn` data has two `CFs`  and `raw` kv backup only support backup one `CF` at a time.

### Teachability, Documentation, Adoption, Migration Strategy:
<!-- If you can, explain some scenarios how users might use this, or situations in which it would be helpful. Any API designs, mockups, or diagrams are also helpful. -->

comment.body:
> In addition, we need to backup/restore twice internally if we choose this way. because txn data has two CFs and raw kv backup only support backup one CF at a time.

@3pointer for TiDB backup, do we also do twice internally? If we use a similar way like backup all databases for TiDB, will it be easier?

issue.title: Backup txn kv data via br
issue.body:
## Feature Request

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:
<!-- A description of what the problem is. -->
We can backup `raw` API data via `br` for `tikv` cluster. but for `txn` API data. we don't have such way to do so. and this will decrease the cluster operation and maintenance capabilities of data loss.

### Describe the feature you'd like:
<!-- A description of what you want to happen. -->
Backup `txn` API data via `br`.

### Describe alternatives you've considered:
<!-- A description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->
One easy way to implement this feature is building backup `txn` kv capabilities on existing `raw` kv backup.
The main process is 
- [ ] implement backup `txn` command in `br`.
- [ ] Get global `txn` snapshot timestamp from `pd` during backup.
- [ ] Build `EntryScanner` to scan valid `txn` kv data in `tikv`.
- [ ] implement restore command in `br`.

In addition, we need to backup/restore twice internally if we choose this way. because `txn` data has two `CFs`  and `raw` kv backup only support backup one CF at a time.

### Teachability, Documentation, Adoption, Migration Strategy:
<!-- If you can, explain some scenarios how users might use this, or situations in which it would be helpful. Any API designs, mockups, or diagrams are also helpful. -->

comment.body: @3pointer no need to control GC? how to guarantee the transaction consistency?

payload.description: A toy project like cowsay or ponysay

comment.body:
IMO, why not write like below to reduce the indention?

```go
if err = f(tx); err != nil {
    tx.Rollback()
    return err
}

err = tx.Commit()
...
```
